pageContext.claim: “1.3 million children have been lifted out of poverty.”
pageContext.analysis: Scholars increasingly believe that the official poverty estimate is somewhat misleading and not especially informative. This is in large part because transfer payments — such as the earned-income tax credit or food stamps — are not recorded as income, so their impact isn’t incorporated into the official figure. To assuage these concerns, the Census Bureau introduced a second poverty measure in 2011 — the Supplemental Poverty Measure. And so while, the official measure has declined, the SPM was statistically the same.
